problem_text: Given that UT = TV and m \angle PQS = 42, find m \angle VTS.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠SRQ, ∠BQA, ∠SPA, P on AU, ∠RSQ, ∠TUP, V on QR, ∠QTV, QU, TU, PQ, ∠QUT, PU ⊥ TU, 3.14 = pi, P on AQ, ∠BQC, ∠TQC, QS, RV ⊥ TV, AU ⊥ TU, S on BQ, ∠VTS, ∠TUA, U on AQ, ∠VTQ, T on QS, ∠QSR, R on CQ, ∠QPS, PS ⊥ PU, V on CQ, ∠BQR, ∠QSP, RS ⊥ RV, ∠BQP, QU ⊥ TU, QV ⊥ TV, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, T on BQ, TU = TV, QT, AP ⊥ PS, ∠QSP, ∠BQU, PS

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠SRQ, V on QR
Conclusions: ∠SRQ = ∠SRV

Step 3:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠QUT, ∠TUP
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUP

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, P on AQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠BQP

Step 5:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TUA

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : S on BQ, ∠BQA
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠SQA

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : S on BQ, ∠BQC
Conclusions: ∠BQC = ∠SQC

Step 8:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠VTS, ∠QTV
Conclusions: pi = ∠QTV + ∠VTS

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on AU, ∠TUA
Conclusions: ∠TUA = ∠TUP

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQA, U on AQ
Conclusions: ∠BQA = ∠BQU

Step 11:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠VTQ
Conclusions: ∠VTQ = 2 * pi - ∠QTV

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on QS, ∠RSQ
Conclusions: ∠RSQ = ∠RST

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on QS, ∠QSR
Conclusions: ∠QSR = ∠TSR

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQC, R on CQ
Conclusions: ∠BQC = ∠BQR

Step 15:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠QPS, ∠SPA
Conclusions: pi = ∠QPS + ∠SPA

Step 16:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Parallel
Premises : PS ⊥ PU, PU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: PS || UT

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : V on CQ, ∠TQC
Conclusions: ∠TQC = ∠TQV

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BQR, S on BQ
Conclusions: ∠BQR = ∠SQR

Step 19:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠QSP
Conclusions: ∠QSP = 2 * pi - ∠PSQ

Step 20:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Parallel
Premises : RS ⊥ RV, RV ⊥ TV
Conclusions: RS || VT

Step 21:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : RS ⊥ RV
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SRV

Step 22:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : S on BQ, ∠BQP
Conclusions: ∠BQP = ∠SQP

Step 23:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QU ⊥ TU
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠QUT

Step 24:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QV ⊥ TV
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TVQ

Step 25:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on BQ, ∠BQC
Conclusions: ∠BQC = ∠TQC

Step 26:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : TU, QT, QU
Conclusions: △QTU

Step 27:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AP ⊥ PS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SPA

Step 28:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠QSP, T on QS
Conclusions: ∠QSP = ∠TSP

Step 29:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : T on BQ, ∠BQU
Conclusions: ∠BQU = ∠TQU

Step 30:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : PQ, QS, PS
Conclusions: △PQS

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QUT + ∠TUP
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TUP

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQA = ∠BQP, ∠BQA = ∠SQA
Conclusions: ∠BQP = ∠SQA

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QTV + ∠VTS
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QTV + ∠VTS

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQA = ∠SQA, ∠BQA = ∠BQU
Conclusions: ∠BQU = ∠SQA

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQC = ∠SQC, ∠BQC = ∠BQR
Conclusions: ∠BQR = ∠SQC

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠QPS + ∠SPA
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QPS + ∠SPA

Step 37:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : PS || UT
Conclusions: ∠QPS = ∠QUT, ∠QSP = ∠QTU

Step 38:
Theorem: Consecutive Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : RS || VT
Conclusions: pi = ∠TSR + ∠VTS

Step 39:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : RS || VT
Conclusions: ∠QSR = ∠QTV

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠TUA, pi / 2 = ∠QUT, ∠TUA = ∠TUP
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TUP

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠TVQ, pi / 2 = ∠QUT
Conclusions: ∠QUT = ∠TVQ

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠TVQ, pi / 2 = ∠SRV, ∠SRQ = ∠SRV
Conclusions: ∠SRQ = ∠TVQ

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQC = ∠TQC, ∠BQC = ∠SQC
Conclusions: ∠SQC = ∠TQC

Step 44:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(U, T, Q)
Premises : △QTU
Conclusions: pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 45:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(S, Q, P)
Premises : △PQS
Conclusions: pi = ∠PSQ + ∠QPS + ∠SQP

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQP = ∠SQA, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, ∠BQP = ∠SQP
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQA

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BQR = ∠SQC, ∠BQR = ∠SQR
Conclusions: ∠SQC = ∠SQR

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QPS = ∠QUT, pi / 2 = ∠QUT, pi / 2 = ∠SPA
Conclusions: ∠QPS = ∠SPA

Step 49:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QSP = ∠QTU, ∠QSP = ∠TSP
Conclusions: ∠QTU = ∠TSP

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QSR = ∠TSR, ∠QSR = ∠QTV
Conclusions: ∠QTV = ∠TSR

Step 51:
Theorem: Hypotenuse-Leg Congruent Theorem
Premises : TU = TV, ∠QUT = ∠TVQ
Conclusions: △QTU ≅ △QTV

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ

Step 53:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQA, ∠BQU = ∠SQA
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠BQU

Step 54:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠SQC = ∠SQR, ∠SQC = ∠TQC, ∠TQC = ∠TQV
Conclusions: ∠SQR = ∠TQV

Step 55:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠QSP = 2 * pi - ∠PSQ, 3.14 = ∠QPS + ∠SPA, pi = ∠PSQ + ∠QPS + ∠SQP, 3.14 = pi, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠SQP, ∠QPS = ∠SPA
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠QSP

Step 56:
Theorem: Congruent Definition
Premises : △QTU ≅ △QTV
Conclusions: ∠QTU = ∠VTQ, ∠QTV = ∠UTQ, ∠QUT = ∠TVQ

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (42 / 180) = ∠BQU, ∠BQU = ∠TQU
Conclusions: pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU

Step 58:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠QSR = ∠QTV, ∠SQR = ∠TQV, ∠SRQ = ∠TVQ
Conclusions: △QRS ~ △QVT

Step 59:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠QSP, ∠QSP = ∠TSP
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠TSP

Step 60:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TUP, ∠QUT = ∠TUP, 3.14 = ∠QUT + ∠TQU + ∠UTQ, pi * (42 / 180) = ∠TQU
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠UTQ

Step 61:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △QRS ~ △QVT
Conclusions: ∠RSQ = ∠VTQ, ∠SRQ = ∠TVQ, ∠SQR = ∠TQV

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠TSP, ∠QTU = ∠TSP
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠QTU

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTV = ∠TSR, ∠QTV = ∠UTQ, 0.84 = ∠UTQ
Conclusions: 0.84 = ∠TSR

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RSQ = ∠RST, ∠RSQ = ∠VTQ
Conclusions: ∠RST = ∠VTQ

Step 65:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠QTU = ∠VTQ, 5.45 = ∠QTU, ∠RST = ∠VTQ
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠RST

Step 66:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠RST, ∠RST = ∠VTQ
Conclusions: 5.45 = ∠VTQ

Step 67:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.45 = ∠VTQ, ∠VTQ = 2 * pi - ∠QTV
Conclusions: 5.45 = 2 * pi - ∠QTV

Step 68:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 0.84 = ∠TSR, 3.14 = ∠QTV + ∠VTS, pi = ∠TSR + ∠VTS, 5.45 = 2 * pi - ∠QTV
Conclusions: 2.3 = ∠VTS
